newsitem.title: USA: Pediatrix backs Q2, 1997 EPS estimates.
newsitem.headline: Pediatrix backs Q2, 1997 EPS estimates.

text.p: Pediatrix Medical Group Inc said Thursday it backed analysts' earnings estimates of $0.30 a share for the second quarter and $1.29 a share for the full year 1997.
"We're comfortable with the $0.30" for the second quarter, Roger Medel, president and chief executive of Pediatrix told Reuters after remarks at a Piper Jaffray investors conference here.
"We're comfortable with that ($1.29 earnings per share estimate for 1997) too. It's accurate," he added.
Pediatrix, which owns and manages pediatric practices, said it is focusing on acquisitions of more neonatology groups.

"Five years from now, we will have penetrated all 50 states," Medel told investors. "We're concentrating on the largest neonatology practices, what we call the nifty 50. We're going after them with a lot of enthusiasm."
Medel also told investors they could expect to see the company acquire perinatology practices by the end of the year.
"About 40 percent of the children admitted to neo-nat(ology) intensive care units are referred by perinatologists, so it makes strategic sense for us to be looking at perinatology," Medel said.
"We are talking to a couple of large groups across the country about possibly acquiring them. I would expect to see some movement in the perinatology area before the end of this year," he added.
